o Treatment
 Lower temperature: tepid sponging, wet towel, fan, antipyrexials (e.g paracetamol)
 IV line with 0.9% sodium chloride for rehydration (may need up to 3 litres of fluid)
 Empiric therapy:
• Ceftriaxone, IV, 1 g, daily for 48 hours, or until fever subsides.
OR
• Gentamicin, IV, 6 mg/kg, daily (ensure normal renal function).
 Switch to oral therapy as soon as the patient is able to take oral fluids:
• Amoxicillin/clavulanic acid, oral, 875/125
